intro: Michauxia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf michauxia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in countries like Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. The plant is characterized by its slender, evergreen shrubs with small, leathery leaves that are typically narrow and elliptical in shape. It produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming in the spring. Michauxia stenophylla is adapted to harsh, alpine environments and is often found growing in rocky soils at high elevations.
